description: The observed symptom resulting from CVE-2024-20660 is an information disclosure vulnerability in Microsoft Message Queuing, which may allow an attacker to read small portions of heap memory. Users on affected systems may notice unexpected information being displayed or leaked, indicating a potential breach of confidentiality. This could occur on various Windows Server builds including Server 2012 R2, Windows 10 versions, and Windows 11 platforms, specifically build IDs such as 10.0.19044.3930 and 10.0.22631.3007. Administrators are advised to monitor for unusual patterns or exposure of sensitive information following the installation of the security updates outlined in KB-5034134 and others. The risk is classified as important, and it is essential to ensure that updates are applied promptly to mitigate the chances of exploitation.
